AEON FLUX is an adaptation of an old MTV show about a sexy freedom fighter in the far flung future. The show was pretty racy, however most if not all of that raciness has been removed for this PG thriller. But the movie version maintains the spirit of the show, as our heroine jumps, runs, fights and shoots her way through a bunch of close calls with the enemy, the corrupt government of the city fortress in which she lives. Charlize Theron apparently did much of her own stunt work, and she got herself into incredibly lithe shape to play the lead character, although personally I would have preferred to see someone with a bit more personality play the role. Jolie comes to mind, for one. The secondary roles are of little matter here, as the film is all about Aeon and her desire to avenge herself on the killers of her pregnant sister. The film was shot in Berlin, of all places, and the look of the film screams DARK CITY and EQUILIBRIUM, while Aeon herself closely resembles the title character from CATWOMAN. If you liked any or all of those films, you likely will enjoy AEON FLUX, which at its heart is a trifle and quickly forgotten.

review_title: The movie's trailer fails to capture the spirit of the movie itself
review_detailed_main:
Remember back in 1999, before the Y2K bust, when you saw the Phantom Menace trailer? Remember when you thought that was the greatest thing you had ever born witness to, and you assumed from it that the movie itself would be one of the finest works ever forged by the hand of man? That to see the movie itself would be to take part in a glorious history that would bring Star Wars to a new age? And then you saw the movie and started asking, "What the hell was that?" This happened to Aeon Flux. Only in reverse.

The trailer was put together by some suit in a Hollywood suite. It was designed to entice the kind of crowd that likes generic action movies starring hot chicks. Basically, the kind of person who would go see Resident Evil even though they had no idea it was based on a video game.

The movie was put together by some rather talented individuals. They were pulling from source material that was incredibly stylized cartoon animation, as well as some mind-screwing narrative. And I mean that in a good way ;) And they were able to pull off a live-action version of the cartoon quite well.

The people who watched the trailer and said, "Hey, I want to see that," are exactly the kind of people who should NEVER see Aeon Flux. They can't appreciate it. The movie that the trailer described wasn't the movie that Aeon Flux was. And the audience that would have appreciated Aeon Flux on its merits was either repulsed by the trailer or are Aeon Flux cartoon zealots who cannot stand visual alterations necessary for such a conversion. And the latter group wouldn't have liked any kind of translation, so they're irrelevant.

So, the trailer ruined any chance of this movie doing well at the box office. So, what was the movie like? Very well done. The greatness of the Aeon Flux cartoon series, to me, was in the characters and in the narrative. And at this, the movie's conversion works very well. If you want to see the stylized visuals of the cartoon series, buy the series on DVD; you're not getting it from this movie.

At its core, Aeon Flux the film is a futuristic action movie with a plot. Not only does it have a plot, it has one that is constantly shifting. For the first hour, if not more, you will be left wondering who the bad guy is, why the bad guy is doing what he appears to be doing, and whether the bad guy is even bad at all? Now, the movie does a great job of explaining everything so that, by the end, you do understand the truth (this, btw, is one of its failings. The cartoon almost never let you know the whole truth by the end).

As an action movie, it's pretty good. However, some of the directing choices in certain fight scenes should perhaps have been considered more; there is a 1 on 1 fight between Aeon and another woman, and it's hard to follow exactly what is going on. Granted, this is the era of the ridiculous quick-cutting of fight scenes, so that is unfortunately to be expected. But even that is a problem in only one scene. Everything else action-wise seems to work pretty well.

Visually, the movie works enough for me, but Aeon Flux purists will likely flee in terror. Charlize Theron in no way embodies the physical being of Aeon Flux, but she does an excellent job of embodying the spirit of Aeon. Likewise with most of the rest of the cast. I suppose that the movie could have been closer to the cartoon visually, but it's certainly good enough for me. And doing so might have been off putting for some who would have otherwise enjoyed the film.

If you're a fan of the narrative aspects of Aeon Flux, or if you're a fan of action movies but would like something more cerebral, give it a rental.

Oh, and any comparisons to Catwoman are flat-out wrong.

But even so I decided to give "Aeon Flux" a try.

Well, I was not disappointed. This film really sucks. It is a stylish artsy fartsy mess. Nothing more, nothing less.

Films that are as dumb as AF are always about mega corporations, rebels, silly superpowers and even sillier heroins lost in some sort of a dystopian world...Hollywood has been using the same recipe, with minor variations ad nauseam

The plot is dull, confusing, a jumbled affair... After a while I could not care less about what was going on. All I knew was that I had to try really hard to stay awake watching it. I could not finish it. The visuals are nice, but that was not enough.

Aeon Flux is a total miss

review_title: Not much to redeem this movie... except maybe side boob.

review_detailed_main: My wife tells me this movie was in the can and held up for a long time before being released. It hasn't aged well. An odor of rancid pork fills the screen, and you can smell someone's career going down the tubes. Charlieze must have gotten well paid for this movie, and I hope she invested it well. The acting, script, special effects, makeup and hair are all universally bad. There is nothing to like about this piece of garbage, except that it does eventually end. Pure drivel for a story line, this concept worked much better as an MTV animation series. Don't waste time or money on this stinker. Her other movie with Stuart Townsend sank without a trace, too. Is this a trend? Even Clash Of The Titans was better.

The technical production of this movie garnered my interest and appreciation. Otherwise, I would have given it a 3 vote. In my opinion, when Charlize Theron has to struggle with lines, the script must be pretty bad. Then there is the basic premise of the film. I am waiting for a sci-fi epic that displays at least a B-minus grade of metaphysical and scientific understanding. I suppose, given the scientific ignorance of the average American, this may never happen. I was very bored by the same old reliance on CGI-martial-arts violence by women in black latex to titillate the teenagers in the prospective audience. Intelligent people also go to movies and have more money to spend in the big picture. When will producers get it? I watched the whole thing and felt the same way I do when I rip through a whole bag of potato chips. Bloated, yet strangely unsatisfied.

review_title: like watching a music video without music
review_detailed_main:
Imagine the Hunger Games without an underlying story.

There are nice looking people on interesting sets. I'm surprised that Theron agreed to be a part of this.

As the original run of the cartoon series on which this is based was never much about the story, but more about the covert actions of a spy/assassin, Hollywood had to scrape every bit of storyline available to mold it into this movie. The end result isn't necessarily bad, but the movie feels overly stylized and remains (barely) standing on mere visual esthetics.

Well, I have not seen the original 1991 animated version of this story. I have come across some reviews presenting its innovative and peculiar way of production. But after I have seen the movie, without an effort to refer to the animation, I felt that the composition of the story within the movie is kind of incomplete missing some key elements. It did make me laugh at some points without intending to do so. When an action-based fantasy movie with a touch a of science fiction in it fails to find an authentic way of presentation of its characters and their struggles, it naturally turns into a charade of funny demonstration. To put it simply, this is not even a bad movie, but a summary of it.

review_title: Not a bad sci-fi film, just not exactly Aeon Flux.
review_detailed_main:
Yeah, I can understand why Peter Chung feels "violated" by this adaption. It isn't very faithful to the animated series. But it's fine for sci-fi fare, and very faithful to the *spirit* of Aeon Flux in many places. It would have been a great sci-fi film if they had just changed the names and filed off the serial numbers to protect the innocent. This is not an Aeon Flux film. It's a pretty decent science fiction film that is sort of inspired by Aeon Flux.

*SPOILERS*

I would have liked to see them tackle the issue of the "split city" that was the whole point of the original series on MTV. But the ending, with the wall coming down, was just great. :) And it was fun to see the subplot about the Relical, which featured in the Herotodus File book that came out around the same time as the Flux "talkies" in 1995. As a fan of the original silent shorts on Liquid TV, I was pleased that this was made into a film at all. I just wish they hadn't changed so much.

Enough has been said about the plot after so much time, so this review is about my opinion of the movie, why I liked it (enough to sign up for an account, which I rarely do) and why I think you will to.

The plot held together. No gaping logic holes, no continuity issues. The characters and their actions and motivations were consistent and believable. The storyline had enough complexity to keep me engaged. The locations were outstanding and really gave the movie a real futuristic feel.

I am a fan of the original Peter Chung animated series, and feel that this movie does the character and plot justice, even though Mr. Chung was disappointed in the movie.

I really don't get some of the earlier criticism of the movie. This movie is every bit as good, if not better, than some of the current action figure movies such as Spiderman and Iron Man.

So if you are looking for a good science fiction movie with a consistent plot, good acting and visuals this one will work just fine.

I really enjoyed "Aeon Flux". I was expecting to watch it for half an hour before turning it off bored, what with how it was trounced by critics. I'm happy to report I turned it off (out of boredom) a mere five minutes before it was over. It's better than most of the sci-fi action dreck out these days. Certainly better than the the last two "Matrix" movies. And a lot more interesting than the first two Star Wars movies, both of which had me yawning by the half-way mark.

BASIC STORYLINE: Sometime in the future a virus kills off most people on earth. The survivors move into a walled city and live in relative peace for the next 400 years under the rule of some kind of dictator or monarch or something (but for a dictator he's an awfully nice guy). A group of rebels, Aeon Flux being one, seek to overthrow the current political regime. All kinds of sneaking around and double-crosses, and gun fights and stuff ensues.

I always found the original "Aeon Flux" cartons dull and weird and nonsensical. Aeon herself was very sexy but it was never clear just WHAT THE HELL WAS GOING ON. Even at fifteen minutes long they strained my patience. I like the film much better. The ideas have been fleshed out and given a shape. The whole thing moves and breathes in a nice way.

Without divulging much, I will say the basic idea behind "Aeon Flux" is Eastern. By that I mean not Western. By that I mean it may be difficult for Westerners to fully grasp or appreciate the concepts at work. It involves the notion of reincarnation and the suffering of beings born again and again.

I love the colors the director uses for this film. So vivid and bright and alive. Extremely delicate, like flowers. I like all of this. It's also a consistently inventive film. There are about twenty little visual inventions in this film that are really cool and fun.

The film has a couple of flaws. Aeon's best friend has hands instead of feet (whose idea was that??) Charlize Theron is a great actress but she seems strangely miscast as Aeon. She has the physique for the part but she seems too grave. Too serious. I think Charlize Theron is better in more serious roles. Also, some of the action relies on quick cutting instead of giving a clear idea of what is going on.

Have to say, though, I was surprised by how good this was.

review_title: My review. Hope it helps someone.
review_detailed_main:
All I want to do here is write a brief, hopefully useful review of this movie. I'm not going to spoil it for you and I'm not going to go on a lengthy rant about what Hollywood does to material it adapts into movies. Finally I'm under no illusions that I'm a film critic. I've seen the animated shorts and liked them. I've seen the movie and wasn't impressed. Here's why:

1. If you loved the animated Aeon Flux you won't find much in this to enjoy. Aside from some names of people and places and a general "look" to the characters and the buildings this isn't Aeon Flux. You won't find her here.

2. If you are like me and you just "liked" the animated Aeon Flux and remember the show then it's not so bad. With no particular investment in the characters and places you can enjoy the few high points. This is standard Action/Adventure with lots of shooting and a few attempts at memorable lines thrown in from time to time. It's not the worst movie of this type I've ever seen but I doubt I'll remember much about it in a years time.

3. If you have never heard of Aeon Flux or know nothing about the original material then this is probably going to come across as a run of the mill Action/Adventure movie that might come across as a little "flat" depending on how much you like movies where dozens of people fire thousands of rounds at one another but rarely hit anything. If this makes you happy then you might really like this movie. The formula is pretty obvious and most of the people in the theater will have figured out what's going on long before the characters on the screen get to the big secret. If you're a "Guns we're cool!" and "Did you see that bomb go off/ Whoa!" kind of viewer (not that there's anything wrong with that) then you won't be mad about the price of the ticket.

One of my friends got a few tickets for the avant-premiere. Ah, to get to see Charlize free ...

8 out of 10 ? Well, I'm getting old or some users didn't see the same movie. I had a tough time keeping myself awake. Some viewers even walked away in the middle of the thing. The girl next to me used her coat as a pillow - no kidding! There was an uncomfortable feeling in the audience - close to pity for Charlize. In what kind of boat did she get on ? You liked this ? Don't tell me : between 13 and 17 years old, right? The staff were checking out people with electronic gizmos to check for cameras, cell phones. I really don't see why they went to all the trouble. No one will bother to download it anyway.

review_title: We're meant to die. Its what makes everything about us matter.
review_detailed_main:
Here we go again! Instead of comparing the movie to a book, critics are comparing it to some animation. Get a life! The movie, as all movies, should stand on its own and be judged as such.

In that light, this was a fascinating SCIFI film that featured a magnificent star in Charlize Theron (Monster, North Country). I didn't even tune into it to see her; she was just a fantastic bonus. In those skin-tight outfits, she was just want I would want in a heroine - beauty and something more.

I actually want to see Sophie Okonedo, having just watched Hotel Rwanda. She played her role well and her new feet were cool.

Marton Csokas (Asylum, Kingdom of Heavon) was also very good and made this a very interesting story in addition to the fantastic action.

Check it out with an open mind.

review_title: Well, it Seemed like an Eon
review_detailed_main:
Now, let me get this straight--Charlize Theron, easily the most beautiful "movie star" since Natalie Wood, got banged up pretty badly making Aeon Flux? Some risks are simply too great.

Aeon Flux is one of the dumbest futuristic/dystopian/heroine- somersaulting-around-in-a-sprayed-on-spandex-thingy wastes of two hours I have seen. Flux (just saying it makes me chuckle at what the movie makers tried to do to me, as in, rhymes-with) is an old- fashioned 70s-sort of idiocy that reminded me, a bit, of John Boorman's Zardoz.

It actually wants to be taken seriously, but how am I supposed to do anything other than mutter "jeez-louise" when Frances McDormand pops up wearing a Julia Roberts fright-mane, another character shows off her surgically implanted hands where her feet were, and Theron, demonstrating athleticism instead of dramatic talent, looks as if she's suffering from a stunt injury?

I saw Aeon Flux on the Scify channel a few days ago. I admire how it appears that the network was able to cram the movie into 88 minutes without losing any crappiness. I don't admire how a cynical piece of garbage like this could get green-lighted. The cynicism comes in the form of assuming that audiences would just flock to see a live- action comic book with Charlize Theron non-acting in a whole-body Speedo.

It's a decade since this movie came out; just enough time for the principals to forget their involvement. I'm not so lucky.

review_title: i took a chance in spite of the preview and i'm glad i did!
review_detailed_main: Æon Flux is not your typical action film, which is what the preview unfortunately makes it out to be. I have not seen Peter Chung's animation yet, but Karyn Kusama's directing makes me want to see more from her. The writing and editing was not as tight as it could have been, but it is still crisp and fresh; and the film is all the more interesting because much of the plot is provided through images and frame composition, scene cuts and facial expressions, rather than dialogue. The crew aimed for "organic" technology inspired by plant life and nature. There were some really beautiful and inspired location choices in Berlin both architecturally and naturally which evoked an absorbing futuristic world. Across the board the acting is excellent, and even the small roles have great scenes.

review_title: An astonishing mess. A few 'boing' effects away from being a classic comedy though...
review_detailed_main:
This was such a dog that I am sure someone was shot after it flopped. And so they should have been. Aside from ensuring Charlize Theron would don an increasingly ridiculous – but form fitting – series of outfits the plot was never going to be any better than banal; 'another virus has wiped out 99% of the population and the survivors live under the tight control of an oppressive regime'. Really? Again?

'Outnumbered but determined rebels take on the oppressors, but find that perhaps not all that it seems. They turn to the mysterious leaders who pass them information for the truth'.

Seriously? How is any of that going to ever be more than average?

Here's what you will remember about Aeon Flux if you're lucky: - Charlize Theron's gratuitous side-boob and wacky loose strings sleepwear. - Her offsider having replaced her feet with hands – it's never effectively explained why. (Does she need feet/hand manicures? I assume she needs four gloves and no socks when it is cold.) - If you're really lucky = nothing. You'll repress any recollection of having seen this. But 'cause you gotta laugh, here are some things that might be worth pondering: - Why on top secret missions when she can't afford to be spotted does Aeon wear luminous white at night and black during the day? - Why in every future do people dress like absolute dicks, have ridiculous hairdos that went out of fashion in the 80s and walk around to a bad techno soundtrack.

That's about it. Aeon moves about like a video game character throughout the film even when there is no reason for it and they spend so long introducing everyone and clumsily getting things in order that by the time something finally happens you're either too confused or simply don't care.

Put another way, the biggest drawback is that the filmmakers took this all seriously, a few 'boing' sound effects and a few net nerd jokes and this could be passed off as a bad MTV joke. But when the lead characters take everything dead seriously and all walk around spouting inane dialogue and looking perpetually confused, what chance does the viewer who remembered Aeon Flux as a cool 4 minute cartoon on telly have?

As a result Aeon Flux is like the rest of MTV to me these days, expensive looking, full of bright colours and pretty young people (Yeesh Charlise in the bodysuit!), loud, noisy and unnecessary.

Final Rating – 4.5 / 10. Those that label Aeon Flux as 'the worst of' anything are wrong. There are worse movies every year. It just sucks.

It's a Sci-Fi action movie with a Charlize Theron. There is lots of action, but screenplay is without a heart. Miss Theron is really, along with Marton Czokas, the brightest movie point and she really shines in a role. I think is time for her to play some romantic comedy. (I loved her portrait of a vulnerable/stubborn with heart of love southern lady in "The Legend of Bagger Vance"). Maybe even some Henry James or Jane Ostin... Johnny Lee did a good job with his villain from a shade, a fanatic with greed for power, maybe in years this roles will be his trade mark... Film is fine directed with a good "future" atmosphere made with shots angles and appropriate scenography... To conclude: A good action film with fast but heartless story and with fine actors. To expect something more than that: no. To watch: yes. In addition: only miss Theron in some futuristic outfit really good looking....

review_title: Just wanna say a word: CRAP

review_detailed_main:
Based on the trailers I believed that this movie was some sort of Tomb Raider clone about a sexy female lead who kicks some ass in the far future. What I saw was that and much much more. This movie is VERY different from the trailers.

Aeon Flux is quirky action movie oozing with style based on an MTV cartoon of the same name. For the fans of the cartoon, the movie has tried to capture the same style and quirkiness however the sexual deviancy of the cartoons is far less pronounced in the movie.

Charlize Theron despite looking not much like the original Flux, does quite a good job portraying the perverted and strong character of Aeon. Although I believe that she could of done with less dialogue.

The action scenes are superbly done and the visual styles of the movie is incredibly original as is the mood. This is unlike any action movie I've ever scene. It feels both stylish and artsy similar to the type of furniture you see at IKEA :P Overall it's definitely worth seeing. If I had to sum up this action movie compared to others in one word it would be: different.

review_title: not very impressive but not that bad either
review_detailed_main:
I did not watch this movie with high expectations because I know that in most modern science fiction movies, good plots and good visuals/acting seldom go hand in hand. With that in mind, I should say that the visuals were fantastic, the plot was somewhat very straight forward. Although,...at the beginning there is really no reason for the rebellion of these secret members....later on we learn what's wrong with the society.

From a technical/genetic point of view, the plot is seriously flawed, as it is the case with The Island and many other such movies. Memories are not imprinted in our DNA. Long term memory is just a process of changes in release of biochemical molecules in the brain that have nothing to do with the DNA. Therefore, memories cannot be propagated via reproduction OR reproductive cloning. So, even if in the future humans can be cloned, their lifetime "memories" cannot.

Charlize Therone was an unusual pick for this role, but I must admit I liked the depth that she brought to Aeon's character due to her own superior acting skills. Someone like Mila Jovovich, who has limited talent for acting in my opinion, always appears angry and without a soul in her roles. So, I disagree with someone who commented here that she should have played this role instead of Charlize. I was a bit prejudiced in watching this movie because I had Ultraviolet in mind, which I found to be much much worse than Aeon Flux- perhaps due to Mila's poor acting and unnecessary fury!

Overall, this is not my favorite recent science fiction film, mostly because sometimes during the movie it is obvious that the creators have run away with the visuals and have left the plot lagging behind!! this causes the viewer to neglect and forget about the "purpose" of the movie and to just become stunned with the graphics. Which ultimately takes away from the effectiveness of the story-telling.

Every now and again you see a preview for a movie and you think "hmmm not sure about this one!" For me Aeon Flux was one of those... Charlize Theron.. great actress, sci fi.. good genre.. a future city where the whole of mankind resides... OK it sounds interesting...

well it's not!! the acting was woeful, character development nil the plot thin and contrived. The only mildly redeeming feature was the premise of the film which could be revisited in another film with better writers and director, and done so much better.

There were some moments that were mildly entertaining, but certainly not enough to warrant spending time or money on this trite garbage. Avoid like the plague.

review_title: Not even bad in a funny way
review_detailed_main:
For all the bad movies i watch it's nevertheless seldom that i stumble upon a complete disaster of a movie. A movie where more or less all ambitions have failed and most of the time the ambitions are not even evident. Aeon Flux is unfortunately such a movie.

I can see what the filmmakers wanted to do here, i really can. A good-looking fresh take on the superhero-genre, a comic-book adaption with style and flare. I see this as an attempt to go where Kurt Wimmers "Equilibrium" went. But this movie falls so shamefully short that it's an embarrassment.

First of all the story is poorly explained and even when i think i get the hang of it, it's still completely without sense or logic. It's a mess of cloning, a repressive society and underground movements. I would seriously doubt the effectiveness of this government though. Considering that the human world is now only consisting of a single city spread out over a quite small space, and yet the authorities are unable to find the dissidents.

Aeon Flux, played by a Charlize Theron who isn't nearly as hot as she usually is although she spends most of the movie dressed in tight leather, is an agent for this resistance movement. How she got the superhuman strength and agility she possesses is never explained, but she jumps, kicks and fights with great intensity. The fight scenes i guess is what could have saved this movie. A weak storyline, poor character development and a non-existent logic to the whole thing can almost always be countered with a nice amount of violence. But here the action is just so poorly made that it fits right into the rest of the movie. People fly this way and that, there is kicking and shooting and none of it raises your pulse a single beat.

There are always a bunch of people that are going to tell you that crap movies like this one are "a lot better than people say". To me though this movie lived up to it's poor rumor completely. When i try to find positive points (i always do) i can think of only two. First of all the movie is not bad-looking. There are some nice sets (very good use of beautiful architecture) and the special effects are not bad. Second the actors are not all lousy although the characters and script they have to work with are so bad that it's hard to notice.

My recommendation would be: stay away. This is not even bad in a funny way.

I have seen only one episode of Aeon Flux animation this movie is based on, so this review won't be biased with my opinions about the original creation.

Aeon Flux (Charlize Theron) lives in a world barricaded inside of a great wall separating it of a jungle, that has claimed the world after 400 years of isolation. The reason for this is, that the man kind is slowly trying to climb out of a pit caused by a disease that same 400 years ago. But there is something rotten with the government and Aeon is a part of a terrorist cell trying to over throw the power.

Visusally speaking 'Aeon Flux' is very interesting. The city scape and design is very well made and the over all look is well executed. Also the action scenes are well made and are a pleasure to watch.

Now plot wise the movie is a different matter all together. There isn't anything wrong with it as such, but it is so cliché ridden, that it serves next to none surprises or aces in sleeves. The movie flows pretty much as you could expect of a movie like this. Also the length of the film could have been a tad longer, as now many things were just waiting to be fleshed out a bit more.

With a bit more effort 'Aeon Flux' could have been a lot better movie, but as it was MTV movie production maybe that wasn't even their goal. I can't say how much of the original there was brought in with the script, but I was surprised how serious the whole film was. I was expecting even a subtle humor that is present in almost every great action film, as that clearly was the main goal the direction was aiming for.

review_title: It's a video game! Logans run for people with no attention span
take it as a light sci-fi action flick and be happy
review_detailed_main:
The film does have its problems. Not unusually for light sci-fi, the revelations as to what is going on is handled too obviously - even if you missed the first part of the movie, you can tune back in and not miss what the story is about. Starting movies with narration typically makes me think the writers and/or director have problems in developing information with finesse. The way personal loyalties vs obedience to authority was worked over is a case in point for me.

I can't comment on the original Aeon character, but then again, even comparisons to the quality of Blade Runner don't stand up for all people who have read and enjoyed PK Dick. However, Aeon has its has interesting elements, and for my money was better to watch than seeing the Matrix for the n'th time.

OK, if you're not a fan of Aeon Flux, then this is a movie for you. Clearly its the fans that are degrading this film. Yes it's not true to the cartoon series, yes its not 'original' as some say, but hey, this is a good action film. I am one of those that used to watch the Aeon Flux television series in the early-mid 90's and after seeing this film, there's seriously nothing wrong about it, I thought the 'twist' was pretty clever also. The only downside I thought was that the director didn't express the storyline effectively. With that story there could've been more emotion. The way it was directed just didn't make you 'feel' for the characters and didn't leave an impression that it should have. To sum up, its an enjoyable action flick using the 'Aeon Flux' title and characters, watch it without any expectations, it's a much better film then first expected.

review_title: Stay the course, it does pan out

review_detailed_main:
alright, first, this movie is not based on a video game. second, that fact doesn't matter, because this movie is nothing but marketing hype.

The dialogue is flimsy, the action is a joke, and you just don't care enough. Especially the action, this is an ACTION film! The action was horrible, lacking excitement or intensity.

Personally, I blame the director, this movie wasn't told well. it had no visual contrasts and the performances were lull. I don't care about the cast, I'm a firm believer that a performance is more the character written, than the actor. Anyone could of played Aeon, they just needed to be tall, athletic, white and female.

To be blunt, this movie sucked. I was excited about the film, which, naturally, led to disappointment.

this is at most a rental, period.

How did I miss this at the time of release? This movie does not get as much stars as it merits. The decor is great, they must have had a modern architect in for the lay-out, I'd hire him on the spot if I could afford it. The shots are very well done, action pace is very good. Story, thin as it is, is very interesting. Maybe the main characters are not very realistic, but that's about the only bad points I would give, the rest outweighs this quite easily.

If you enjoyed the first Matrix, bond movies, the Bourne movies, and do enjoy Charlize Theron in a tight outfit you really will not be disappointed..

review_title: Style over substance, but an engaging style
"We're meant to die. Its what makes everything about us matter."
review_detailed_main:
Aeon Flux (Charlize Theron) is an assassin in the year 2415. She works for a group of rebels intent on overthrowing the government. Her target is Trevor Goodchild (Marton Csokas), the leader of what's left of Earth. But before Aeon can pull the trigger, something strange happens. A memory is sparked of a previous life when she knew Goodchild. She discovers that for the past 400 years everyone on Earth has been infertile. The human race has carried on through an intricate system of cloning. Trevor tells her that he is near to finding a solution to the problem. But there are some who would have things stay as they are. Trevor Goodchild's brother, Oren (Jonny Lee Miller) has plans to overthrow Trevor to maintain the status quo. Aeon changes her mission - now she must protect Trevor, stop Oren, and end the cycle of cloning.

I'm really starting to hate the modern brand of action movies. What happened to the good old days when it was all about shooting people and blowing things up? Why do filmmakers feel the need to hide their action movies behind a faux sense of intelligence? Despite all the weird flashback scenes, the annoyingly vague character motivations, and the intentionally muddled plot points, Aeon Flux is no smarter than any other action movie. In fact, all this pseudo-intellectual garbage does is confuse matters to the point the movie becomes incredibly dull. Scene after scene of people talking nonsense does not make for a good action film. And that's just what you get in Aeon Flux. Add to that some of the most uninteresting characters I've seen recently and you've got the makings of an infuriatingly boring movie. The worst offender in this regard has to be Jonny Lee Miller (though if truth be told, no one comes out looking good - and that includes Charlize Theron). Miller is so dry, so white bread, he's hardly menacing at all. Laughable would be a better description.

And why do filmmakers today feel the need to make every action movie look like The Matrix? I'm no physicist or human physiologist, but people and things don't move and/or behave in nature like they do in these movies. There's a scene where Aeon is about to fall on sharpened blades of grass (oh, how clever). The way she holds herself just inches above the ground with nothing but the insides of her feet is impossible. I'm so tired of seeing this kind of thing.

For what it's worth, I'll rate Aeon Flux a 3/10.

review_title: Loved it more than Hated it ..
review_detailed_main:
This is a tough one - great special effects, excellent idea for a story but terrible realization as a movie. Somehow though, I'm glad I saw it - made me think of possibilities I hadn't imagined.

The basic story is about a potent female warrior in the 25th century that is assigned to take down a dictator. But it's a little more interesting that that. A plague has reduced the human population to 5 million and they all now live in single hi-tech city. Furthermore, things aren't quite right in both the government and the people...

I won't spoil where the plot goes, but the story that's revealed is pretty interesting. In fact, the special effects are pretty good too. However, the movie as a whole is a bit of a mess.

review_title: Dull and uninspired futuristic action flick
review_detailed_main:
Aeon Flux is a prime example of a film in which the filmmakers decided on a look, and forgot about the rest of it. The film is supposedly based on a cartoon, and the Mtv logo that comes before the movie starts is very fitting as this film takes in all the flashy photography and silly action scenes that you would associate with the popular music channel. Actually, I think this sort of thing would work well as a cartoon, but as a film; it's laughable. We start off with a bit of back-story, which is the common 'virus has wiped out humanity' sort of thing and then we move on to a series of shots of the central location - a futuristic city inside an airtight dome - and it all looks rather nice. Everything is going well up until the lead character introduces herself, and we realise that like the back-story; we've seen all this before. The plot follows a mysterious assassin working for an organisation calling themselves 'the Monican', who hope to bring down the central rulers governing the city. However, as the agent infiltrates her target; several secrets about the founding's of the last city on Earth begin to emerge

There is a scene in this film in which our heroine finds herself in a jail cell. She escapes by whistling through the air vent, which causes a load of metal balls to spring up from somewhere and blow the door open. This scene sums the entire movie up, as the writers seem to think that the audience will either accept everything that is thrown at them, or somehow know why and how it has happened. Obviously, you have to expect some crazy inventions in a futuristic world; but everything just seems far too covenant. The lead actress is the Oscar winning Charlie Theron, who gives a dull and forced impression of the title character. Her performance relies largely on her good looks and lean form, however, and she does look the part. Support comes from Jonny Lee Miller, Pete Postlethwaite and Frances McDormand, all of which fail to make any kind of impression. The twist mid-through is well presented, although it's as unoriginal as the rest of the film. Despite the director's eye for beauty, which sees picturesque scenes set among blossom trees and in bright white rooms; none of it comes across with any artistic value as the action scenes are dull and uninspired, while the script lacks any real characterisation. Overall, Aeon Flux is simply a bad film, and one which I cannot recommend.

review_title: The Fact MTV Films Produced This Tells You All You Need To Know

This wouldn't be anywhere enough to maintain a civilization that we know today . Of the 70 million who have survived many would fall by the Darwinian wayside with the survivors living in self sufficient communities similar to those seen in the Bronze age . Eventually things would progress and trade across the continents would follow then the cruel necessity of industrialization and eventually a world like we have today . However this would take many centuries not just over 300 years as seen in AEON FLUX . If I remember this illogical process of apocalypse quickly followed by technological regeneration is one of the major flaws of THE HUNGER GAMES

That said you very quickly realise internal logic is not a priority with this film . You might notice that one of the production companies is MTV Films and that tells you all you have to know . The gossamer thin premise involves mankind being crushed under the fascist jackboot of a dynasty and it's up to a rebel called the Monicans to defeat them . Shades of BLAKES 7 or LOGANS RUN perhaps but at least they developed plots that the audience understood . This movie doesn't even try to paint a convincing picture of the future because everything is about hot chicks in general and Charlize Theron walking in slow motion or being involved in breaking bad guys necks whilst wearing skin tight PVC . Everything about the film screams MTV as it jumps from one under explained action set-piece to the other along with blink and you miss it editing and in your face camera movement . One feels slightly about the collective intelligence of humanity that this film has a relatively low rating at the IMDb

When I first saw the advance publicity for this film, my immediate thought was why? Having watched the animated series without ever having the slightest clue what was going on - but being riveted nonetheless - my firm conclusion was that any live action film of this series would be impossible.

I was right - the only similarity between the series and the film are the names of some of the characters and the city and the fact that it is set in the future.

But I actually liked the film on its own terms, but not for the usual reasons. Yes, Charlize Theron looks great in the outfits and is a good athletic, if somewhat one dimensional, action heroine. The futuristic city and costumes look good, but what really interested me was the performance of New Zealand actor Marton Csokas playing Trevor Goodchild.

Csokas managed to squeeze every last intensely romantic drop out of his underwritten role. As he said in an interview about the film - the way he performed the role was to play Romeo to Aeon's Juliette. review_title: Even Action Thrillers Can Ask Pertinent Questions
review_detailed_main:
In 2011, a deadly virus kills 99 percent of the Earth's population. Four centuries later, the entire human population, around five million people, live in a single walled city, Bregna, while the rest of the planet has been reclaimed by nature. Bregna is ruled by an autocratic government headed by the Goodchild family, descendants of the scientist who eventually found a cure for the virus. Opposition to their rule is growing, however, and a group of rebels known as the Monicans has sworn to overthrow them. The title character Æon Flux is a member of this group, a young woman with advanced athletic and martial-arts skills. She is tasked by the group's leader, the Handler, with a mission to kill Trevor Goodchild, the ruler of the city.

So is this a "government bad, rebels good" piece of sci-fi along the lines of "Star Wars"? Not quite. The real situation is more complex than that. Æon discovers that Trevor is something quite other than what she had believed him to be and that the Monicans are being manipulated by a group within the government which want Trevor dead so that his more hardline brother can seize power. She also makes some startling discoveries about the origins of Bregna and of its population, including herself.

"Æon Flux" is a film which has come in from a lot of criticism on this board, in the press and elsewhere, much of it coming from devotees of the American animated television series on which it was based. Even its star, Charlize Theron, does not seem to have liked it very much and Peter Chung, creator of the original animation, seems to have disowned it. I have never seen the TV series- as far as I am aware it was never shown in Britain- so I am not in a position to make comparisons, but my view is that the film is not that bad.

I must admit that I liked Theron better here than I did in the very overrated "Monster" from two years earlier, the film for which she unaccountably won a Best Actress Oscar. "Æon Flux" is not the sort of film for which the Academy hand out Oscars- science fiction is not their favourite genre- but Theron makes a cool, stylish Æon, psychologically more complicated than your standard sci-fi hero or heroine. She is someone who has to reassess her entire world-view when she discovers that the cause to which she has given her life is essentially based upon a lie and that the man she has been ordered to kill, far from being an evil tyrant, is himself a well-intentioned idealist and, moreover, someone with whom she is starting to fall in love. The lovely Charlize copes well with the challenge of portraying such a complex figure. (I would have preferred it if she had kept her trademark blonde hair, but she had to become a brunette, apparently to make her look more like the Æon of the cartoon series).

In 2005 the concept of a deadly viral pandemic must have seemed like a tired sci-fi cliche, the noughties equivalent of all those nuclear Armageddons from the Cold War era. Since the Covid outbreak of 2020, it is starting to look a lot more scary. The film also taps into modern concerns about genetic engineering and government conspiracies; it may be an action thriller, but even action thrillers can ask pertinent questions. "Æon Flux" is never going to be regarded as one of the great science-fiction classics like "Forbidden Planet", "Planet of the Apes" or "Blade Runner", but when you consider how many dreadful films the genre has given rise to, you realise that it could have been a lot worse than it is. 6/10.

review_detailed_main:
This movie takes places in a distant future (2400-something), but none of that really matters. The only real "scifi" is that one person has hands instead of feet, the rest could just as well be Chicago 2022.

Anyway...A lot of action, some of it really cool, a lot of it badly directed, and a really silly and very thin plot. You never really get any feel for any of the characters, and the main plotline is based on the fact that the writer(s) don't understand most basic of the sciences they try to use. It's ok for a Popcorn movie, but don't expect any real depth or clever plottwists.

99% of humanity has been wiped out by a virus; now, 400 years later, some five million people live in the only remaining city on the planet, headed by the benevolent Goodchild family. A band of rebels, wishing to overthrow the Goodchild dynasty, sends an assassin named Aeon Flux (Charlize Theron) to kill Trevor Goodchild (Marton Csokas). But Aeon finds that things are a little more complicated than as first surmised. Turns out there are mysterious things afoot, and when Aeon learns this, the rules and her mission change dramatically.

Superstylish and straightforward, the movie is an extension of an old MTV animated short. It's a lot of fun to watch, and even the plot isn't boggy or otherwise incomprehensible. And that's saying something, because so often these movies tend to have some kind of intentionally murky plot, the better to distract people from the fact that it's badly written. This film doesn't quite perform that little parlor trick; in fact, even though the special effects are the main attraction, the storyline does stand up to close scrutiny.

Theron, as usual, is fantastic; she brings spirit and panache to a role that would have been much less effective with a straight-ahead action femme. She comes across to the viewer as commanding, strong, and mentally and physically tough. In short, an outstanding performance by a wonderful actress.

She doesn't get much in the way of support, but it's not really because the other actors aren't as talented; the film is, after all, called Aeon Flux for a reason. Csokas and Jonny Lee Miller as Trevor's brother are both a grade or so better than bland. They're not particularly colorful characters. Sophie Okonedo, as Flux's compatriot Sithandra, fares a little better, but her role is even smaller.

The visual effects in the film are a real delight, particularly the land around the inner part of the city, where the reigning family lives; there's supersharp grass, trees that fire upon intruders, and so on. Inventive, even mesmerizing, each scene is brilliantly woven with the next, creating a tapestry of oh-my-goodness images.

(Side note: The group for which Aeon works is called the Monicans. Now, that can't be related to American pop-political culture, can it?)

review_title: Miscast Theron and Watered-Down Writing Sink Otherwise Promising Adaptation

review_detailed_main:

Good and evil; friends and enemies; love and hate; life and death... this eye-catching film explores all of these dualities and blurs the distinctions, yet ultimately lets the audience decide.

Visually pleasing and intellectually stimulating... in the end, it is just plain fun to watch and escape into an alternate reality that is really not so far removed from our own.

review_title: Overall, a very well directed movie that gets a bad wrap from critics (and wannabe critics regurgitating bad critic reviews)
review_detailed_main:
Although I was a fan of Aeon flux and own the complete animated series, I was hesitant to see this film in theaters as I heard and read so many horrible reviews. Normally if reviews are great to mildly mediocre, I check the movie out for myself, but the ratings from 1-10 that IMDb have given to this plot are quite ridiculous and relatively unfair. After finally viewing this movie for myself, I'm ashamed to have listened to the ratings and reviews of my fellow peers. When I looked at the votes on this movie, many were 10, and many were 1. This is why this movie got such a mediocre rating. IT would appear that some people who weren't expecting a movie that wasn't spoon fed a coherent, well-structured plot within the first 10 minutes couldn't handle watching the movie through, or at least keep an open mind long enough to delve into plot before writing it off as horrible. I fear that some people feel foolish when they don't comprehend or understand something, be it plot, storyline, or otherwise. Rather than trying to figure out what they don't understand, they become offended that they don't comprehend it at first glance and thereby rave about how horrible it must be (to give themselves closure and not feel inadequate). Such was the early cases of movies such as 12 monkeys and Matrix. These are the same folks that walk out on credits, walk out ten minutes into a movie because "they don't get it" or "its not funny", fall asleep half way through movies with any form of character development or dialog (without an explosion going off every 5 minutes or someone showing their breasts in a scandalous scene). These people are fans of many genres, its not to say that they are incompetent, immature, or have bad tastes. But it is to say that they are a bit biased and ignorant. The problem with Aeon flux is that it combines a dramatic mystery with a popcorn action flick. What we have is children and huge popcorn ADD ridden action buffs that don't know what the hell is going on between explosions, and snooty film critics uninterested in trying to utilize their pompous minds to dissect the plot long enough to realize that its not just a bunch of random futuristic hogwash and explosions that they can snoot their noses to and claim to be somewhat of a ripoff of "cat woman" or "i robot".

What I'm saying is: While this movie may not be something that you're used to, are you truly doing it justice with votes within 1-5. That being said, have any of you ever seen a movie that truly deserved a rating that low? Movies that have the feel of B movies but had the budget and acting talent to be so much more. I found this movie to be very inventive, the graphics and action crisp, and the plot full of twists and quite complex. Even so, if one took the time to pay attention (sorry ocd/add moviegoers) to the general storyline of the movie long enough to release your biases and expectations as to what you think a good movie should be or what should be happening in the plot; you might just find yourself enjoying this film and becoming interested with its unique storyline and character development. This film, like memento, matrix, 12monkeys,fightclub, Is not meant to go down smoothly, it is meant to make you think, to pay attention, to appreciate every scene and piece together the plot rather than having a generic regurgitated script unfolding before you. It is meant to take you out of your comfort zone and think outside the box, to push the envelope. Come on guys, those of you who claim that its completely worthless, is there truly nothing you can appreciate about this film? The budget was only 50 something million? Compared to ridiculous budgets in the 200 millions given to movies like x-men 3 "final stand". An ironic name for a movie that spent so much time trying to hint at sequels rather than work on closure from the first two films or a little character development in the new characters introduced. (not that I'm saying that movie is bad, but thats an entirely different topic).

review_title: If it weren't for the explosions, I would've probably fallen asleep

Admitly, Charlize Theron is gorgeous. However, the acting was not quite as gorgeous. I'm guessing it's more an issue with the script, as the whole movie's characters were rather subdued. "Oh look! There's a giant explosion and we are possibly going to die! Let's look strangely calm and collected while we are running for our lives! Yay!" The storyline in general wasn't all that interesting. They presented the plot so confusingly that you really didn't understand until at least halfway through. I believe in subtility, but not tell the viewers and make them guess what is happening doesn't do as well.

The whole thing was just not well written. The theme of the story weren't presented until the very end. It seemed like basically throwing it in at the end like, "Oh, this is why we told you this great big story and made it all confusing," which completely devaluized the movie itself.

What I did really enjoy, though, were the visuals. They were intriguing and well-edited, and vastly fitting for the epic adventurous movie they were trying to present. If it weren't for them, I might've fallen asleep.

Overall, this movie had a lot of potential for the epic it bragged. However, I feel it's a mainly faulty script that made it go awry. It might've been phenomenal if it did.

This is movie with bigger budget, impressive sets, some well known actors, interesting story, and it just left not good impression, what is visible in IMDB average rating too, what is approx. same as mine.

Afro-american actress Charlize Theron is gorgeous as always, and this is rare case that she is with black hair, but that is part of film's visual, it seems. and it is OK. Was not impressed with Marton Csokas acting, but really not sure who to blame. Seemed somehow bland, little absent. This is action movie most part, and fight scenes were cut in so small pieces that it just resulted in losing proper view of what really happens. OK, maybe not so relevant, it was clear from start, that our heroine will win all it :-)

Unfortunately, other action scenes, like those with attacking that flying something were directed poorly too. Too much slow motions, some rather ridiculous body flying scenes . Pacing was bad in most cases, even with dialogs. Add to it not good editing, and that's is it. 90 minutes looked as more.

Too bad, because story deserved really better approach.

Some movies are horrible....and this one isn't. That's about the nicest thing I can think of. The script is pretty lame, but there are some nice sets and costumes. Theron, while picking up a check, looks great and is fun to watch as she kicks butt.

The side performances are pretty forgettable, though it was mildly amusing to check out McDormand and Postlethwait. They appeared to enjoy themselves a tad.

All in all, Aeon Flux had the sets and the right cast, but it had no heart and not much of a mind. They should have probably gone for the nutty and smutty tone of the animated series.

Good Movie, but NOTHING TO DO WITH THE SERIES!!!!
review_detailed_main:
They bought the Title and Characters from Chung and made a movie that had nothing to do with the series. I was disappointed at that. I really wanted to see a live action Aeon Flux movie. The movie did prove to be entertaining, at least for the effects and and Sci-fi coolness that comes along with the title. Good flick if you have never seen the series.

I will write a spoiler comment after this one, explaining the reasons why this movie did not fit the title of Aeon Flux. One of the only things that came from the series was the fly. That is all I will say for now.

Aeon Flux is a deadly assassin working for the rebels known as Monicans. Flux is sent on a dangerous mission to assassinate the government leader Goodchild, but hesitates when he calls her by a different name. Flux gets imprisoned but later escapes and tries to unravel a mystery that has been going on for 400 years.

I never saw the anime this film was based on, but I can tell you right now it was probably visually stunning. With Aeon Flux, no matter how much it stayed true to the source material, is not visual stunning. In fact it's not a lot of things, good is being the prime example. I must ask this question though, what is it with Best Actress winners doing the most horrible pieces of crap right after their Oscar win? Swank, Berry and here we have Theron. Is it some kind of code they must take?

The film is not as big as it could have been or wanted to be. It has an epic scope written all over it, but comes up really short in it's delivery. The film opens with the usual sci/fi fare, with text written on the screen explaining to us what happened to lead us up to these events. Is this a requirement now for every sci/fi film? It's cool ideas within the plot are neat, but fail to capitalize with anything else, are get dragged down with the rest of this heap.

The film is a short one, clocking in at a whopping 90 some odd minutes. It's as if they just gave up half way through the film and decided to end it as soon as they can, this is evident in the poor acting, directing and overall feel of the film. What should have been a visual extravaganza with high octane martial arts and gunfire left right and centre, ends up being a child's film that takes it easy with the violence. The martial arts are uninspired and lack anything that would make the lead character dangerous. Sure there is a scene or two were the visuals do seem good, but given what the source material is, they could have done so much more.

I found myself rolling my eyes at the horrible dialogue given by the horrible actors. Marton Csokas, who you may remember as "THAT GUY" from xXx, The Bourne Supremacy and Kingdom of Heaven brings the film down so much with his monotone voice projection that you laugh at everything he says and does. Theron seemed to be only interested in the check that came her way and the fact that she got to look good after being uglied up for Monster.

Skip this sci/fi lite film, it takes good talent and wastes them (McDormand, Postlethwaite and yes even Theron). All the action scenes are juvenile, the acting horrendous and the script laughable. Pass this one when you see it sitting on the video stand and thank god that you will never have to watch it.

review_title: Actually pretty decent overall. No waste to me.
review_detailed_main:
Boy, seems this film is getting dogged by critics, the fact they didn't allow it to be viewed by critics before release, (which is far more often then not a very bad sign), however not here in my opinion.

Look... if your interested in this kind of film at all, you'll probably like it. Yet it was a two pronged fork for me. Meaning, at times it seemed I was watching a decently budgeted Sci-Fi flick. Yet at other times, it seemed it was a Sci-Fi Channel wanna-be-a-bigger-film.

The fight scenes...a let down. Charlize didn't pull it off and the directer obviously didn't believe in her or a bigger budget for the fight sequences. Far too much quick cut editing during the fights to cover up the weakness of them. However all together, the action wasn't too awful bad.

The STRONGEST point of this film to me... the STORY. It actually had a pretty good story. Not as graceful most of the time telling it as it could have been however quite interesting and overall done well. In addition, the creativity of the plot, gadgets, background and conceptual design are well worth mentioning.

One stickler to me was the acting of Marton Csokas, (Trevor). I like this guy however it seems when he plays 'nice' or 'sympathetic', he doesn't sell if for me, least not in this film. He's a strong presence on screen and I look forward to seeing more of him yet in this role I just didn't feel it from him when he turned to the good guy.

So with some of the problems of this film, I'd guess they would weigh more toward the director, Karyn Kusama, as there are too many common denominators that could have been far better done yet for some reason were not. Instead of getting someone who's directed only one other film, Girlfight 5 years prior, they should have invested a little more for a director with the caliber that could have made this film much closer to what it 'should and could' have been.

Overall I enjoyed this film. Yet if you have an expensive pair of shoes with dirt all over them, it's hard to see the shine it could have. Even though muddied, it's a good film yet again, it could have shined far more than it did. Too bad too.

review_title: A good script left off to YAWN

review_title: Am willing to acknowledge some lack of understanding
review_detailed_main:
I saw this in Dollar movies recently,mostly out of curiosity,Charlize Theron and because I wasn't exactly flush with money but wanted to go to a movie. I have to say that,given my rating,I wasn't really knocked-over by this,but I am willing to acknowledge that perhaps this is due to my lack of real running knowledge about the MTV series and comic book.

Hundreds of years into the future,in a walled-society that traced back to a vague "industrial disease" that killed off 90 percent of the human population back in the 21st century. This society,once Utopian,had now grown restless with rebels who wished to leave the city and spread out,who were in turn treated as menaces,thus starting an endless war between the Goodchilds(descendants of the man who both created a cure for the disease and the society for which they live)and their followers,and the resistance.

Among the resistance is a long-legged,attractive and athletic woman(Theron,who can act,but here is just inserted to be merely eye-catching and sympathetic)who is-of course-the title character. As she tries to get closer to the truth as to how and why she is in this war,she discovers she has some sort of bond with none other than the leader of the enemy himself,Trevor Goodchild(Marton Csokas).

A decent spate of scenery chewing from Jonny Lee Miller(another great actor,Pete Postelthwaite is almost an afterthought here) and vividly colorful scenes and photography make this show certainly palatable,but I'm afraid if you're either not too familiar with the series or are a stickler for Sci-Fi that ISN'T wrapped around some rather neat and tidy plot concepts,you're probably gonna come away from this film feeling flat. But I suppose I could say in its defense that maybe,if this show's concept intrigues you at all,to see it for yourself and you be the judge.

review_title: Excellent movie, nice actress, I haven't seen something similar to this movie.
review_detailed_main: Nice and dangerous, I like the actress....Well I must say,I did have high hopes for this movie,after seeing the trailer and I walked out of the theater feeling deeply disappointed.Sure,it had a pretty good plot outline,and some of the action was o.k.It had it's exciting moments but most of the time I found myself feeling kinda bored.The very end of the movie was kinda lousy,the acting was just average,and the pace could have been a bit better.The whole movie was like being in a big video game.If you want to see a action packed movie,go ahead and see Aeon Flux.It's a kind of movie that you could love or you could hate. And I like it. Don't know why. Game would by o.k

The movie was short, which was a killer, but it was better than I expected. Growing up, I watched the show on MTV, but never really for the plot. Like the movie, I remember the show being as simple with the plot, although, the show itself was just awkward; this why I enjoyed it. The dialog was strange, the characters were strange, generally, just a show one watches if they enjoy weird sci-fi. I think the movie was done well, especially because it focused on strange characters, esoteric costumes, body movements and scenery. Nothing had a real feel to it, which might make one question the believability of the movie (many movies having bad CG), but the movie did such a great job of portraying the weird, it took my attention away from any plot holes or the like. I think with what they had to work with, the movie was good. That, and Charlize Theron is incredibly beautiful.

review_title: I should have listened to my friends
review_detailed_main:
Most of my friends saw this movie in the theaters, I rented, I wasn't too interested. My friends even told me not to waste my time, but my mom and I love Charlize and I guess I was curious. 5/10

review_title: Charlize Theron??? Come on now people!

review_detailed_main: I just came from seeing Aeon Flux and I have to say I'm pretty impressed. I'm not a fan boy of the series, I've seen maybe a handful of episodes. The last time I saw an episode was 6 months ago. Anyway, back to the movie. The movie does a good job at setting up the world and the style. I was impressed as an art student at the set designs and locations where they shot. The movie also keep true to Peter Chung(Matriculated from the Animatrix, The Chronicles of Riddick: Dark Fury and more) style. It really felt that it was like watching anime at times with the terrific style. But for the story, I felt that the story was great, it had several turns and no plot holes like some movies do. I was pleasantly surprised and the story kept me guessing what was the back story and how did things come to be. It also makes you think, what if the elements of the story could come true, or maybe they're already happening...? So if you'd like to see a solid movie with a great plot that makes you think and entertains you, then see this movie. One other thing, Charlize Theron did a wonderful job portraying Aeon. She's strong, smart and sexy without being too sexualized.

This title should really be given two separate reviews. For those of us who watched Peter Chung's series of shorts waiting to see a snippet of Aeon then sitting for hours trying to piece the flashes together and guessing at the storyline. To us this movie is horrible it should not have any association with the great series of the same name 2-3 for these viewers. For those of you who have not seen the series this is a very well made action sci-fi movie with a decently deep plot. Think a watered down matrix combined with a watered down 2001 ASO. It has an oldschool vibe to it with clashes slightly with the modern production techniques. The storyline flows though and there are some strong twists. I give it a 7-8 for these viewers.
The blinking action scenes are SOOO borig. The story is very predictable. Esthetically Beautiful. Desapointing for the Aeon Flus series fans. Good enough for for a Hollywood movie.

review_title: fun but could do without the romance
review_detailed_main: 'Aeon Flux' is a science-fiction action film about a female rebel who is sent to murder the leader of the city in which all the humans live. During her task, she uncovers some truths about society and about her life. The film has some good ideas and good science fiction substance, but by the end of the film, it ends up being a cheesy romantic soap opera. The action toward the end of the film was hardly engaging either, despite the film starting off with an action-oriented mindset and some interesting ideas. The worst thing about the film was the romance incorporated into the film toward the end of the movie, and its explanation that the romance held in terms of significance in the story. However, this is probably a science fiction film that most females can enjoy. I would say it is a fun film, but I would not give it anything more than that.

review_title: Not ground breaking cinema but entertainment nevertheless.Follows a foolproof formula.
review_detailed_main:
An assassin fighting a totalitarian, fascist society in the future where the people have lost their freedom for supposed happiness. But wait everything is not what it seems.

Hell how original is that!! No point for guessing that one cannot expect blockbuster material from this movie.But add a hot heroine, some good action sequences in a visually appealing futuristic world and you have a formula that has never failed and ensures that this movie is at least watchable.

The movie futuristic eden is very well created and the fact that the people mostly wear colour but Aeon wears only black and white seem to capture the desolation that she feels in this supposedly perfect world very effectively.

The cinematography and sets etc are indeed the best part about this movie.Visually this is a absolute brilliant movie with liberal use of water, colours, black and white, steel etc. The movie is filled with aesthetic scenes and is literally a visual treat. If that is what the future will look like i cant wait to live in it hehe.

The acting of this movie is top notch but sadly Charlize Theron looks out of place playing a hard hitting,tough heroine, something that only one or 2 women of her beauty have been able to achieve (Milla Jovovich being the prime among them), her out-of-placeness had definitely affected this movie. Special mention goes again to the 2 villains and Marton Csokas in particular who was definitely the best actor in this film. I was not to happy with the casting of Sophie Okonedo as the other assassin as well.In fact the overall casting of the movie was mediocre.

The movie also lacks in the department of the big action scenes and the end again left a lot more to be desired.

The best part of the movie indeed was the middle of the movie where Aeon enters the enemy fortress and is captured and then escapes.

The science fiction of the movie was interesting but also left us with a lot of plot holes.

The effects as expected were first rate and i really loved the scene where the steel balls help her escape.

The movie also has very few funny one-liners (but the ones that are there including the non-funny ones were great) and overall this movie lacked humour which may have been on purpose.

The background sound were run of the mill and again could have definitely been better.

This movie may be predictable but its definitely not boring, the visual brilliance, the interesting fiction, the beautiful actress and the handful of action scenes keep you interested throughout this short movie.

Good time-pass if you are an action-sci-fi fan but don't expect much.

Okay, here's a review that just let's you know if the film is any good rather then listing all the background and what the actors previously did and stuff (I kinda feel, your reading this on the IMDb, so I don't need to say all that).

Aeon Flux is not a ground breaking film, but it's well worth a watch. The plot twists are all obvious but if you can forgive the characters being a little slow on them that's not a big problem for the film. Visually the film is excellent and the action is good too. The dialogue and acting is all pretty reasonable. So if your after a bit of excitement and a good visual experience you won't be disappointed. However, if your after a clever sci-fi film that makes you think, you probably should avoid it.

I think that explains the surprisingly low voting this film is getting. As I said it's not ground breaking. It's no contender for the top 100. But it is entertaining and with that in mind I cannot call the film a failure.

review_title: Very underrated - Almost missed a gem of a sci-fi

Great characters, intriguing plot, suspense, great hi-tech gadgetry, romance, -- what's not to like? I can surmise that the initial reviewers were big fans of the graphic novel of the same name, and it didn't match up as accurately as they wished, so they rejected it with a low rating. If you predicted the end at the beginning of the movie, you might get it right, but the journey there would be a different route. If you're on the edge, jump off, and see this.
